page.title: 03ST. CHAD'S CHURCH, LONGFORD
page.content: Longford church is very ancient. It is about half a mile from the village itself. It is called St. Chads. Part of it is Norman. The font is Norman and there are Norman pillars. At the beginning of the 14th century the outer walls were rebuilt. This made the aisles wider and the chancel longer. The walls are made out of stone. Longford church was repaired in 1843, the cost was Â£11,000. The church has two altars because there is a chapel in the church. The church has six bells which were made between 1721 and 1786. The bells are rung before and after a service. There is a tall cross in the graveyard. The cross was restored in 1897.
